abstract: In this lesson, students will reflect on their reading experiences in and out of school and discuss the roles that both nonfiction and fiction have played in their lives. After learning what the Common Core State Standards and its critics say, they discuss the question, "What should children read?"

byline.original: By AMANDA CHRISTY BROWN and KATHERINE SCHULTEN

headline.main: Fiction or Nonfiction? Considering the Common Core's Emphasis on Informational Text
